Title: Driver Drowsiness Detection Based on Face Feature and PERCLOS
Affiliations: Master in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Junaedi, S., Master in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Akbar, H., Master in Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Driving vehicles are complex and require undivided attention to prevent road accidents. Fatigue and distraction are a major risk factor that causes traffic accidents, severe injuries, and a high risk of death. Some progress has been made for driver drowsiness detection using a contact-based method that utilizes vehicle parts (such as steering angle and pressure on the pedal) and physiological signals (electrocardiogram and electromyogram). However, a contactless system is more potential for real-world conditions. In this study, we propose a computer vision based method to detect driver's drowsiness from a video taken by a camera. The method attempts to recognize the face and then detecting the eye in every frame. From the detected eye, iris regions for left and right eyes are used to calculate the PERCLOS measure (the percentage of total time that eye is closed). The proposed method was evaluated based on public YawDD video dataset. The results found that PERCLOS value when the driver is alert is lower than when the driver is drowsy. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Health risks; Highway accidents; Contactless systems; Driver drowsiness; Electromyo grams; Face features; Physiological signals; Steering angles; Video dataset; Vision-based methods; Human computer interaction
